div1.p: Getman sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from F.H. Getman to Howard A. Kelly, July 1, 1907
div1.opener:
STAMFORD HIGH SCHOOL
DEPARTMENT OF CHEMISTRY
F. H. GETMAN, PH. D.
Take up
question of
Carnegie Hero Fund
STAMFORD, CONN., July 1' 1907.
My dear Dr. Kelly;-
div1.p:
In the last issue of
the “Outlook” I read the account
of Mr. Kissinger's sad condition
resulting from his noble act
in the cause of Medical
Science and humanity-

I am sending my check
for twenty-five dollars as a
small token of my appreciation
of his self-sacrifice and I hope it
may be the means of aiding
him until the Government takes
action in the matter-

I only wish that my means
permitted me to do more for
this man- I am ashamed
STAMFORD HIGH SCHOOL
DEPARTMENT OF CHEMISTRY
F. H. GETMAN, PH. D.
STAMFORD, CONN.,_______________19
to think that Congress has
not taken the matter in hand
and provided for everything the
man might wish- No
financial recompense can pay
for such a deed, I should
think he would be more than
eligible for assistance from
the Carnegie Hero Fund.

I thank you for having
brought the case to the attention
of the public and hope the
response may be generous.
